findings.title: A01.Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The minting implementation allows for an unlimited number of sundae tokens to be created, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Inconsistent strategy for transaction data size
findings.description: The current tx data size of 65 bytes is unachievable through the combination of different ABI datatypes but can be reached without them.

findings.title: Error Handling Discrepancy
findings.description: The `ParseInstruction` function handles errors in a manner inconsistent with the existing codebase.

findings.title: Architectural Concerns in Mint Instructions Implementation
findings.description: The audit report highlights difficulties verifying the MintState contract runtime bytecode and its hash due to inadequate instructions.

findings.title: Inconsistencies Detected in MintState Contract Bytecode
findings.description: A discrepancy has been identified between the MintState contract's bytecode and the `MintState.sol`. Notably, the string literal 'Available only for owner' is absent in the decompiled bytecode of the MintState contract.

findings.title: Missing backports for vulnerable dependencies and DoS mitigations
findings.description: Several important changes and bug fixes were implemented in later versions of Geth (after 1.10.26), including PR 27038 which cleans the `commitTransaction` function in the miner/worker and improves DoS resilience, and PR 26907 which is an alternative solution for checking if the transaction is executable quickly.

findings.title: Changes to Block Sealing Logic Ineffective in Mitigating Block Reorgs
findings.description: The changes intended to mitigate block reorgs are ineffective, disrupting concurrency and causing block reorgs to persist.
